newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Two dead in Philippine ship explosion-coast guard.
newsitem.headline: Two dead in Philippine ship explosion-coast guard.

text.p: At least two crew were killed on Saturday after a Philippine-registered oil tanker exploded while anchored at the port of Batangas near Manila, the Philippine Coast Guard said.
One member of the 21-man crew was injured and another was still missing after a blast damaged an empty tank of the 1,957-tonne M/T Crane North, Coast guard officer Regalado Quiacos said by telephone.
Quiacos said the Coast Guard was investigating the cause of the incident. He added that there was no report of any oil spill.
